texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I added a  DisplayLink USB to DVI adapter  to my MacBook Pro a while back and it occasionally has some issues where it won't start the display after connecting the USB cable. My logs in Console.app usually contain something like this:
texts.text: I added a  DisplayLink USB to DVI adapter  to my MacBook Pro a while back and it occasionally has some issues where it won't start the display after connecting the USB cable. My logs in Console.app usually contain something like this:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
The IOUSBFamily is having trouble enumerating a USB device that has been plugged in.  It will keep retrying.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily was not able to enumerate a device.
The IOUSBFamily is having trouble enumerating a USB device that has been plugged in.  It will keep retrying.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily was not able to enumerate a device.
The IOUSBFamily is having trouble enumerating a USB device that has been plugged in.  It will keep retrying.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily gave up enumerating a USB device after 10 retries.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily was not able to enumerate a device.
texts.text:
The IOUSBFamily is having trouble enumerating a USB device that has been plugged in.  It will keep retrying.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily was not able to enumerate a device.
The IOUSBFamily is having trouble enumerating a USB device that has been plugged in.  It will keep retrying.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily was not able to enumerate a device.
The IOUSBFamily is having trouble enumerating a USB device that has been plugged in.  It will keep retrying.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily gave up enumerating a USB device after 10 retries.  (Port 4 of Hub at 0xfa100000)
The IOUSBFamily was not able to enumerate a device.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The solution is a bit goofy, but here's what you can do:
texts.text: The solution is a bit goofy, but here's what you can do:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Unplug the adapter from the USB port.
texts.text: Unplug the adapter from the USB port.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Disconnect the DVI cable from the DisplayLink adapter.
texts.text: Disconnect the DVI cable from the DisplayLink adapter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Power off the display you normally use with the adapter.
texts.text: Power off the display you normally use with the adapter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Connect the USB cable between your computer and the DisplayLink adapter.
texts.text: Connect the USB cable between your computer and the DisplayLink adapter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Wait for your displays to flash (as if a new display was connected).
texts.text: Wait for your displays to flash (as if a new display was connected).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The light on your DisplayLink adapter should be on now.
texts.text: The light on your DisplayLink adapter should be on now.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Connect the DVI cable to the DisplayLink adapter.
texts.text: Connect the DVI cable to the DisplayLink adapter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Wait a few seconds and then power on the display connected to the adapter.
texts.text: Wait a few seconds and then power on the display connected to the adapter.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If this process doesn't work, try a reboot and repeat the process once Finder finishes starting up.
texts.text: If this process doesn't work, try a reboot and repeat the process once Finder finishes starting up.
